required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Functional Image-Guided Carbon Ion Irradiation With Simultaneous Integrated Boost for Prostate Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Functional Image-Guided Carbon Ion Irradiation With Simultaneous Integrated Boost for Prostate Cancer: a Phase II Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Shanghai Proton and Heavy Ion Center

clinical_study.source: Shanghai Proton and Heavy Ion Center

brief_summary.textblock: This is a phase II randomized controlled clinical trial to assess the toxicities and clinical efficacy of prostate specific membrane antigen (PSMA) positron emission tomography / computed tomography (PET/CT) and multi- parameter Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) guided simultaneous integrated boost for prostate cancer.

detailed_description.textblock:
Local recurrences of prostate cancer following radiotherapy often originate from the primary tumor site. Therefore,focal boost to the primary gross tumor has been proposed to increase biochemical disease-free survival (bDFS) without increasing toxicity.
The higher relative biological effectiveness (RBE) and greater cytocidal effect on the intrinsic radiation resistant cancer cells offer carbon ion radiotherapy (CIRT) advantages over conventional radiotherapy. In this study, carbon ion were used to treat localized prostate cancer and simultaneous integrated boost to the gross tumor in the prostate specific membrane antigen (PSMA) PET/CT and multi- parameter MRI.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 3 months of the start of CIRT
primary_outcome.description: Treatment related acute toxicity assessed by Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 4.03

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months after the completion of CIRT
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment related late toxicity assessed by Radiation Therapy Oncology Group (RTOG) scale

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the complation of CIRT,a median of 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: The prostate specific antigen less than nadir plus 2ng/ml (Phoenix definition)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the diagnosis of prostate cancer,a median of 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: The time from diagnosis to death from any cause

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the complation of CIRT,a median of 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: The time from complation of CIRT to tumor progression or death

other_outcome.measure: The quality of life-International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS)
other_outcome.time_frame: From the complation of CIRT, a median of 5 years
other_outcome.description: IPSS would be used to assess the severity of lower urinary tract symptoms, based on the answers to seven questions regarding urinary symptoms (incomplete emptying, frequency, intermittency, urgency, weak stream, straining, and nocturia). Total IPSS score: 1-7: Mild; 8-19: Moderate; 20-35: Severe

other_outcome.measure: The quality of life-Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite (EPIC)
other_outcome.time_frame: From the complation of CIRT, a median of 5 years
other_outcome.description: EPIC would be used to evaluate the urinary, bowel, and sexual symptoms. The EPIC is a patient reported outcomes instrument designed to evaluate bowel, urinary, sexual and hormonal domains both during and after irradiation of the pelvis.For each domain, responses are provided on a 5-point Likert scale, and multi-item scale scores are transformed linearly to a scale of 0 to 100, where higher scores correspond to better quality of life.

arm_group.description: All patients will receive carbon ion irradiation with 65.6 GyE in 16 fractions to the prostate with or without seminal vesicle

arm_group.arm_group_label: Carbon Ion Irradiation With SIB group
arm_group.description: All patients will receive carbon ion irradiation with 65.6 GyE in 16 fractions to the prostate with or without seminal vesicle, and with simultaneous integrated boost (SIB) to the gross tumor in the PSMA PET/CT and mpMRI

intervention.description: All patients will receive carbon ion irradiation with 65.6 GyE in 16 fractions to the prostate with or without seminal vesicle

All patients will receive carbon ion irradiation with 65.6 GyE in 16 fractions to the prostate with or without seminal vesicle, and with simultaneous integrated boost (SIB) to the gross tumor in the PSMA PET/CT and mpMRI
intervention.arm_group_label: Carbon Ion Irradiation With SIB group

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pathologically confirmed adenocarcinoma of prostate
- Stage cT1-3N0M0 localized prostate cancer
- performed PSMA PET/CT and mpMRI before treatment
- No lymph nodes or distant metastasis
- Age ≥ 45 and < 85 years of age
- Karnofsky Performance Score ≥70
- No previous pelvic radiation therapy (RT)
- No previous prostatectomy
- No previous invasive cancer (within 5 years before the prostate cancer diagnosis)
- Ability to understand character and individual consequences of the clinical trial
- Willing to sign the written informed consent; Informed consent must be signed before the enrollment in the trial
Exclusion Criteria:
- No pathologically confirmed adenocarcinoma of the prostate
- Pelvic lymph node metastasis (N1)
- Distant metastasis (M1)
- Previous pelvic radiotherapy
- Previous prostatectomy

facility.name: Shanghai Proton and Heavy Ion Center

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Shanghai Proton and Heavy Ion Center
